keyTakeAways: Sam Rivers, the bass player in Limp Bizkit, has died, according to band members.
Rivers was praised as 'pure magic' and 'the soul in the sound' by his bandmates.
The band did not disclose the cause or location of death, but emphasized his irreplaceable musical and emotional presence.
Fred Durst expressed deep grief, saying he has shed 'gallons and gallons of tears' and called Rivers 'so talented I can't explain'.
Rivers had a history of heavy drinking leading to liver disease and underwent a liver transplant in 2018 before rejoining the band in 2018.
Limp Bizkit is scheduled to tour Central and South America beginning in late November 2025.
The band members shared a love of grunge music, citing Mother Love Bone, Alice in Chains, and Stone Temple Pilots.
Rivers' ability to evoke 'beautiful sadness' through his bass playing was highlighted by Durst as a defining quality of his artistry.
Limp Bizkit originated in Jacksonville, Florida, and developed a unique blend of alternative rock, heavy metal, and rap.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sam Rivers, the bassist of Limp Bizkit, has died, prompting the band to publicly mourn his passing and celebrate his profound influence on their music. The band members, including front man Fred Durst, described Rivers as 'pure magic' and 'the soul in the sound,' emphasizing his irreplaceable talent and emotional presence. Rivers, who left the band in 2015 due to health issues related to heavy drinking and liver disease, underwent a liver transplant and later re-joined the group. The band, which originated in Jacksonville, Florida, and blends alternative rock, heavy metal, and rap, is scheduled to tour Central and South America in late November 2025. The article highlights the deep personal and artistic bond between band members, as well as Rivers’ unique ability to convey emotional depth through his bass playing, which was inspired by classic grunge bands like Mother Love Bone, Alice in Chains, and Stone Temple Pilots.
title: Limp Bizkit Band Members Say Bass Player Sam Rivers Has Died
